name: Hodge Close to Cathedral Quarry, Tarn Hows and Coniston

ai.summary: A gentle 5.3 km lakeside walk in the Lake District, linking Hodge Close, Cathedral Quarry, Tarn Hows and Coniston. The easy route passes mining relics, woodlands and calm waters with rewarding lake views along the shores.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating paths. Expect some uneven ground and loose stones near quarry areas. There are short boardwalk or grassy stretches near Tarn Hows, and occasional wet patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and watch for uneven ground, especially near quarry edges. Stay on marked paths and respect private property around the quarry sites. Weather in the Lake District can change quickly; bring a waterproof layer and warm clothing. Take care near Tarn Hows and lake edges, as edges can be slippery. If walking with children or dogs, keep them close and on paths. Carry water and a map or mobile GPS in case of detours.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for the best balance of daylight and scenery; summer can be busier, while winter visits require extra care due to mud and weather.

seo.title: Hodge Close to Cathedral Quarry, Tarn Hows and Coniston – Easy 5.3 km Lakeside Walk in the Lake District
seo.meta_description: Explore an easy 5.3 km lakeside route connecting Hodge Close, Cathedral Quarry, Tarn Hows and Coniston in the Lake District. Gentle terrain, historic quarry sites and tranquil lake scenery.
